solution_line_template: The food is going to cost Calum a total of {num_food_boxes} boxes of food * ${cost_per_food_box} per box of food = $<<{num_food_boxes}*{cost_per_food_box}={total_food_cost}>>{total_food_cost}.

This leaves ${total_budget} budget - ${total_food_cost} spent on food = $<<{total_budget}-{total_food_cost}={remaining_budget_for_disco_balls}>>{remaining_budget_for_disco_balls} to spend on disco balls.

Calum can therefore afford to spend ${remaining_budget_for_disco_balls} remaining budget / {num_disco_balls} disco balls = $<<{remaining_budget_for_disco_balls}/{num_disco_balls}={cost_per_disco_ball}>>{cost_per_disco_ball} on each disco ball.
